reason: Task analysis: Determine the exact number of images in the latest 2022 version of the English Wikipedia Lego article, requiring precise identification of the correct revision and systematic image counting. All three members successfully identified the same target revision (ID: 1128616160 from December 21, 2022), demonstrating strong convergence on article identification. However, significant divergence occurred in image counting methodologies and results. Member 1 and Member 2 both employed wikitext markup parsing using regex patterns to identify [[File:...]] and [[Image:...]] references, reaching identical results of 12 images (10 JPG, 1 PNG, 1 SVG). Their approaches were methodologically consistent, focusing on actual article content images embedded in the wikitext. Member 3 used a hybrid approach combining Wikipedia Parse API and HTML parsing, reaching 29 images by including UI elements, navigation icons, and interface components beyond the article content itself. Critical evaluation reveals that Members 1 and 2 correctly interpreted the task as counting images within the article content proper, while Member 3 expanded scope to include all visual elements on the page. The question asks specifically about images 'in the article,' which should refer to content images rather than interface elements. Cross-validation through multiple independent approaches (Members 1 and 2) using the same sound methodology provides high confidence. Member 3's broader interpretation, while technically comprehensive, exceeds the reasonable scope of 'article images.' Final validation confirms 12 as the accurate count of images embedded within the 2022 Lego Wikipedia article content.
